definition: big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
Italy/Italian/abbr. for 意大利[Yi4 da4 li4]

sentences.english: Carelessness deserves the blame for many accidents.
sentences.chinese: 许多事故归咎于粗心大意。

sentences.english: The typist received an admonition from the supervisor for being careless.
sentences.chinese: 那个打字员因粗心大意受到监督人的训诫。

sentences.english: I'm awfully sorry for my carelessness.
sentences.chinese: 对付我的粗心大意我非常歉仄。

sentences.english: This accident was caused by the negligence of a nurse.
sentences.chinese: 这次事故是由一个护士的粗心大意造成的。

sentences.english: Do be careful with the experiment you're doing.
sentences.chinese: 在实验中切不可粗心大意。

sentences.english: But he is a thoroughly unreflective one.
sentences.chinese: 但他绝对是粗心大意的人。

sentences.english: Bob cut himself by fooling around with a sharp knife.
sentences.chinese: 鲍勃粗心大意，用快刀把自己割伤了。

sentences.english: From what I have heard from other faculty, he's really scatterbrained.
sentences.chinese: 我从其他老师那里听说了，他真的是粗心大意。

sentences.english: Social media is a minefield for the unwary.
sentences.chinese: 但社交网站是还那些粗心大意者的雷区。

sentences.english: He was backed into by a careless driver this morning.
sentences.chinese: 今天早晨他被一个粗心大意的驾驶员开倒车时撞着了。

sentences.english: Teacher twitted me for about my carelessness.
He was so careless that he came to class without his book.
sentences.chinese: 他粗心大意上课连书都不带。

sentences.english: Imprudence or thoughtlessness in money matters would be unpardonable in me.
sentences.chinese: 我要是在银钱问题上粗心大意，那是不可原谅的。

sentences.english: Holmes: Alright, let's explore this. What was she doing that seemed ditzy?
sentences.chinese: 好，我们来研究下，是神马让她看起来粗心大意呢？

sentences.english: Mistakes due to carelessness may have serious consequences.
sentences.chinese: 由粗心大意造成的错误有可能带来严重的后果。

sentences.english: Q7:Does carelessness usually affect your score in the exam?
sentences.chinese: 考试的时候你经常因为粗心大意而被扣分么？

definition: a careless person/scatterbrain/frivolous and forgetful/abbr. for 馬馬虎虎、大大咧咧、嘻嘻哈哈|马马虎虎、大大咧咧、嘻嘻哈哈
thick stems and broad leaves (idiom)/boorish/rough and ready/sloppy
to only want to have a good time/to just want to have fun, and to shy away from self-discipline
to neglect to take precautions/relaxed vigilance
to slip/to overlook by negligence/careless omission/oversight
to fail to pay sufficient attention to/to be negligent in regard to/to be lacking in
